intro: Cymopterus panamintensis var. acutifolius, commonly known as the Panamint pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the deserts of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, pale blue to lavender flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has a compact growth habit and is adapted to arid environments with well-drained soils. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, and the flowers are arranged in dense, compact clusters. This variety is closely related to other members of the Apiaceae family, which is known for its aromatic compounds and often edible plants.
